introduction.para: This procedure outlines the steps required to replace a fork on a motorcycle. The document includes preliminary requirements, main procedures, and closing requirements.

safetyPrecautions.para: No specific safety precautions are mentioned in the procedure.

supportEquipment.item: Saw horses or a motorcycle lift

step.title: Remove Front Wheel
step.para: Remove the front wheel, referring to Front Wheel Removal Procedure.

step.title: Remove Front Brakes
step.para: Remove the front brakes, referring to Front Brake Removal Procedure.

step.title: Remove Fork
step.para: Remove the fork, referring to Fork Removal Procedure.

step.title: Change Bike Axis
step.para: Change the bike axis, referring to Bike Axis Replacement Procedure.

para.item_For_Configuration_A: For configuration A: Install the new fork, referring to New Fork Installation Procedure for Configuration A.
para.item_For_Configuration_B: For configuration B: Install the new fork, referring to New Fork Installation Procedure for Configuration B.

step.title: Install Front Brakes
step.para: Install the front brakes, referring to Front Brake Installation Procedure.

step.title: Install Front Wheel
step.para: Install the front wheel, referring to Front Wheel Installation Procedure.

step.title: Test Fork Installation
step.para: Test that the fork is properly installed, referring to Fork Installation Test Procedure.

step.title: Front Brakes Test
step.para: Perform a front brakes test, referring to Front Brake Test Procedure.

closingRequirements.para: No specific closing requirements are mentioned in the procedure.

notes.item: This procedure assumes that the user has basic knowledge of motorcycle maintenance and repair.
It is recommended to consult the motorcycle's manual for specific instructions on fork replacement.
Always follow proper safety protocols when working with power tools and machinery.
